badger_status_blocked_scripts.message: Blocked cookies and fingerprinting scripts from $DOMAIN$

breakage_warning_tooltip.message: Blocking this domain is known to break websites

deprecated_setting.message: The following setting has been deprecated and will be removed in a future Privacy Badger update:

description.message: Privacy Badger automatically learns to block invisible trackers.

disabled_for_these_domains.message:
Privacy Badger is disabled on the following sites. This means that Privacy Badger will not block anything when you visit the sites listed here, and it will not send the Do Not Track or Global Privacy Control signals.

If you think Privacy Badger is breaking a page, or you would like to allow a particular site to share or sell your data, you can type that page's domain in the box below and click the "Add domain" button.

dnt_tooltip.message: This domain promises to not track you

download_cloud_failure.message: Cloud data could not be downloaded.

extension_error_text.message: Please tell us about the following error:

feed_the_badger_title.message: Click to return control of this domain to Privacy Badger

firstRun_title.message: Thank you for installing Privacy Badger!

first_run_text.message: Learn how Privacy Badger protects your privacy

google_signin_tooltip.message: To enable logging into websites with your Google account, move this slider right, and reload the page

import_select_file.message: Please select a file to import.

import_successful.message: Tracker list and settings updated successfully!

intro_beyond_ads_paragraph.message: Invisible tracking happens in all sorts of ways; ads are just the visible tip of the iceberg. Privacy Badger sends the Global Privacy Control signal, to opt you out of data sharing and selling, and the Do Not Track signal to tell companies not to track you. If they ignore your wishes, Privacy Badger will learn to block themâ€”whether they are advertisers or trackers of other kinds.

intro_by_eff.message: A project of the Electronic Frontier Foundation

intro_disable_button.message: If you think Privacy Badger is breaking a page (a video doesn't play, for example), you can click the 'Disable' button to turn off Privacy Badger for that site.

intro_donate1.message: When you use Privacy Badger you join the Electronic Frontier Foundation and millions of other users in the fight for privacy. We are a nonprofit fighting for your rights online. Thanks for joining us!

intro_donate_subheading.message: Help us by donating and sharing your support for our tools

intro_learns_paragraph.message: Instead of keeping lists of what to block, Privacy Badger automatically discovers trackers based on their behavior.

intro_not_an_adblocker.message: Not an ad blocker, I'm different

intro_not_an_adblocker_paragraph.message: Privacy Badger starts blocking once it sees the same tracker on three different websites. Three strikes and it's out!

intro_pin_instructions.message: To pin Privacy Badger's icon, click on the puzzle piece icon in your browser toolbar. Then, click on the pin icon next to Privacy Badger.

intro_pin_nudge.message: First, $START_SPAN_TAG$pin Privacy Badger to your toolbar$END_SPAN_TAG$ for easy access to the "$DISABLE_FOR_SITE$" button.

intro_privacy_note.message: Privacy Badger will NEVER share data about your browsing unless you choose to share it.

intro_report_button.message: Please don't forget to click on 'Report broken site'. We respect your privacy so we don't send automatic reports.

intro_text1.message: You're now protected by Privacy Badger.

intro_text2.message: To learn how Privacy Badger works, click below for a quick tutorial.

intro_welcome.message: Privacy Badger automatically learns to block invisible trackers. Take a minute to see how.

invalid_domain.message: Please add a valid domain or URL

learning_prompt_button.message: Learn how Privacy Badger is changing

learning_prompt_text1.message: Privacy Badger will no longer learn from your browsing by default.

local_learning_warning.message: Enabling learning may make you more identifiable to websites

manage_data_intro.message:
Importing user data:
  • Overwrites general settings
  • Combines lists of disabled sites
  • Combines information about what trackers Privacy Badger has seen
  • Overwrites slider customizations

non_tracker.message: The domains below don't appear to be tracking you

non_tracker_tip.message: Currently Privacy Badger only checks if third parties are using cookies, HTML5 local storage, or canvas fingerprinting to track your browsing. Some of these domains may be using tracking methods that Privacy Badger can't detect.

not_yet_blocked_header.message: Your Badger hasn't decided yet if these domains should get blocked

options_disable_google_nav_error_service.message: Disable sending web addresses you visit to Google. This disables suggestions for similar pages when a page can't be found.

options_disable_hyperlink_auditing.message: Prevent sites from tracking which links you click ("hyperlink auditing")

options_dnt_policy_setting.message: Check if third-party domains comply with EFF's Do Not Track policy

options_domain_list_no_trackers.message: Privacy Badger hasn't detected any tracking domains yet. Keep browsing!

options_domain_list_sites.message: $DOMAIN$ was seen tracking on the following sites:

options_domain_list_trackers.message: Privacy Badger has decided to block $COUNT$ potential $TRACKER_LINK_START$tracking domains$TRACKER_LINK_END$ so far

options_domain_search_tooltip.message: To exclude domains, prepend your search term with "-". For example, ".co -.com" will show .co and .co.uk but not .com domains.

options_enable_dnt_checkbox.message: Send websites the "Global Privacy Control" and "Do Not Track" signals

options_hide_in_seed.message: Hide domains present in the latest pre-trained list

options_incognito_warning.message: Enabling learning in Private/Incognito windows may leave traces of your private browsing history on your computer. By default, Privacy Badger will block trackers it already knows about in Private/Incognito windows, but it won't learn about new trackers. You might want to enable this option if a lot of your browsing happens in Private/Incognito windows.

options_learn_setting.message: Learn to block new trackers from your browsing

options_remove_origin_confirm.message: Are you sure you want to remove this domain from Privacy Badger?

options_show_nontracking_domains_checkbo.message: Show domains that don't appear to be tracking you

options_show_not_yet_blocked.message: Show domains your Badger hasn't decided yet to block

options_widget_replacement_desc.message: When blocking social buttons and other potentially useful (video, audio, comments) widgets, Privacy Badger can replace them with click-to-activate placeholders.

options_widget_site_exceptions_label.message: Always allow widgets on these sites:

popup_blocked.message: There are no third party resources on this page. Hooray for privacy!

popup_disabled_site_header.message: Privacy Badger is disabled on this site

popup_info_firstparty_description.message: Some websites $LINK_START$use link tracking to follow you$LINK_END$ whenever you click a link to leave the website. Privacy Badger removes tracking from such links on this website.

popup_info_youtube.message: Ads not blocked? YouTube not working? It's probably not because of Privacy Badger.

popup_special_page_header.message: Nothing to do on this page

popup_special_page_paragraph.message: Privacy Badger doesn't work on special pages like this one. Try browsing somewhere else.

remove_all_data_confirm.message:
Removing all tracking domains will:

  â€¢ Delete everything Privacy Badger knows about trackers
  â€¢ Cause Privacy Badger to not block anything until it has had a chance to re-learn from your browsing

report_success.message: Thanks! We'll get to the bottom of it.

report_terms.message: This will automatically send the following information to EFF: the page you're currently visiting, your browser version, the version of Privacy Badger, and the state of all of the sliders on this page.

reset_data_confirm.message:
Resetting tracking domains will:

  â€¢ Delete all data about trackers that Privacy Badger has learned from your browsing
  â€¢ Restore the tracking domain list to the latest pre-trained list (visit www.eff.org/badger-pretraining to learn more)

share_base_message.message: Privacy Badger (privacybadger.org) is a browser extension that automatically learns to block invisible trackers. Privacy Badger is made by the Electronic Frontier Foundation, a nonprofit that fights for your rights online.

share_tracker_header.message: Privacy Badger blocked $COUNT$ potential trackers on $DOMAIN$:

social_tooltip_pb_has_replaced.message: Privacy Badger has replaced this $BUTTON$ button

sync_intro.message:
Cloud sync:
  • Requires Firefox/Chrome Sync
  • Upload overwrites any existing Privacy Badger data in the cloud
  • Download combines the lists of sites where your Badger is disabled

tooltip_allow.message: Move the slider right to allow a domain

tooltip_block.message: Move the slider left to block a domain

tooltip_cookieblock.message: Center the slider to block cookies

upload_cloud_failure.message: Data could not be uploaded to the cloud

upload_cloud_success.message: Data successfully uploaded to the cloud
